title: [html] Jump to after next opening HTML tag

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
It would be great if there were a keyboard shortcut which moved the cursor to within the next HTML element, right after the opening tag. This would be really useful, because Emmet is great for building out the structure, but then I have to type in the data and it's a lot of mouse clicking / arrow keys.

For example, say I am starting here:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22269691/65483112-f1ade980-de4f-11e9-85f7-4ed96b9bd3f4.png)

and I want to move the cursor here:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22269691/65483182-2752d280-de50-11e9-8593-694d3883eca5.png)

I'd like to do this with one keyboard shortcut instead of 5 arrow presses (I know Ctrl can be used with arrow keys to navigate between words but it is still an issue)

title: "Go to Definition" for Absolute path doesn't work with folder named "I18n"
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Windows 10.0.18362

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a React app with create react app
2. Create `jsconfig.json` with these settings
```
{
  "compilerOptions": {
    "baseUrl": "src"
  },
  "include": [
    "src"
  ]
}
```
3. Create a folder named `I18n` with some code to export
4. Import the code from `I18n` folder
5. `Ctrl+Click`(Go to definition) the code to navigate to the I18n definition

## Expected Result
- Navigated to the code definition in `I18n` folder

## Actual Result
- It doesn't Navigate at all 

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

title: [Debug] Launch In Terminal still goes to the previous terminal window after i change the default shell
body:
- VSCode Version: 
```
Version: 1.39.0-insider (system setup)
Commit: de03947834d0bcf55093b97c292b76faa75cdebc
Date: 2019-09-23T08:25:10.478Z
Electron: 6.0.9
Chrome: 76.0.3809.146
Node.js: 12.4.0
V8: 7.6.303.31-electron.0
OS: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18362
```
- OS Version:  Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create HelloWorld.java in VS Code.
2. Set cmd as the default shell.
3. Click Run codelens on top of main method, it will open a cmd terminal to run the program.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14052197/65474472-8f380600-deae-11e9-94f4-ff252e02b04d.png)
4. Change the default shell to powershell, and click Run codelens again.
5. The generated command line style is powershell style, but VS Code still run it in the previous cmd terminal so that it failed. But if i kill all existing terminals, clicking Run codelens will be able to launch the correct terminal.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14052197/65474858-fb673980-deaf-11e9-833e-c721fb5adc7e.png)

Expected: Launch In Terminal should open the correct terminal to run the program.

title: VSCode Portable: Distinguish between different machines when restoring session on startup

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
I was trying to use VSCode Portable on two different Mac machines. An issue I ran into is VSCode's attempt at opening the last open files / windows in the last session when launching the app. I don't have the exact same files on both machines, and would actually just prefer that VSCode portable would distinguish between the two machines and save a set of open windows / files on for each machine.

As a result, when I open VSCode on machine 1, it attempts to open some files that are not present on that machine, which in turn makes VSCode not attempt to open those files when launching on machine 2, which do have the files.

Alternatively I have to maintain two portable versions of VSCode: VSCode-iMac and VSCode-MacbookPro. Currently this is the only feasible option if I want to use portable, but it doubles the disk space usage. Duplicating the app is particularly cumbersome with VSCode because it's a an app that has ~10^4-10^5 files, many more than a typical app. Most of the files are very small, yes, but the sheer amount of files being changed frequently makes VSCode Portable very sync-heavy. All of this is to say, I'd prefer not to have two copies of VSCode for that reason, but I'd still prefer to use portable mode for other reasons (e.g. no need to install on fresh systems + ability to use on system without admin access).

The best would be the ability to group machines together "these two machines are work, these two are personal", allowing the use of one single portable installation for many machines, some sharing the same purpose and set of available projects/files, but otherwise sharing the same extensions and setup by virtue of being one portable installation.

title: Insert Line After KeyBinding cannot be overridden
body:
Issue Type: Bug **Issue**: In VSCode version 1.38.1 when I tried to find and replace all in a file using "Ctrl+Enter" a message popped up saying "Ctrl+Enter now inserts line break instead of replacing all. You can modify the keybinding for editor.action.replaceAll to override this behavior." I went to keyboard shortcuts and modified `editor.action.replaceAll` to `Ctrl+Enter` and changed `Insert Line Below` to `Ctrl+Alt+Enter`, after this and after restarting VSCode pressing `Ctrl+Enter` on the flind and replace widget inserts a line break and replaces all, even though `Insert Line Below` has been set to `Ctrl+Alt+Enter` **Actual**: 1. Change VSCode keybinding for `Insert Line Below` to something other than `Ctrl+Enter` and set `editor.action.replaceAll` to `Ctrl+Enter` 2. Open a file and write a few lines 3. Press `Ctrl+H` to open Flind and Replace 4. Turn on regex search 5. Find `\n` and replace ` ` (single whitespace) this should have the effect of removing all newlines 6. Press `Ctrl+Enter` this inserts a line break in the replace all box event and replaces all in the file **Expected**: 1. Change VSCode keybinding for `Insert Line Below` to something other than `Ctrl+Enter` and set `editor.action.replaceAll` to `Ctrl+Enter` 2. Open a file and write a few lines 3. Press `Ctrl+H` to open Flind and Replace 4. Turn on regex search 5. Find `\n` and replace ` ` (single whitespace) this should have the effect of removing all newlines 6. Press `Ctrl+Enter` this replaces all in the file VS Code version: Code 1.38.1 (b37e54c98e1a74ba89e03073e5a3761284e3ffb0, 2019-09-11T13:35:15.005Z) OS version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.18990

title: shortcut for moving to other half of a split view

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
There is a simple shortcut for moving cursors between "panes", i.e. "ctrl+[Num_of_pane_to_move_to].
But I think there is no shortcut that allows moving to the other side of, e.g. a git diff view.
To me it would feel quite natural if "ctrl+[Num_of_currently_active_pane]" moved the cursor to the other half of the active pane, iff the the active pane has a tab in focus that is split.

I frequently find myself missing that feature to quickly copypaste from the original revision of the file.

Maybe this is a worthwhile idea for a new shortcut, or maybe it already exists and I simply didn't find it yet?
All the Best.

title: External terminal not registering Ctrl+C with .NET Core
Bug: Markdown > Preview: Open Markdown Links setting not respected
body:
- VSCode Version: 1.37.1
- OS Version: Windows 10, build 18362.356

### Description:
VS Code does not appear to respect the `Markdown > Preview: Open Markdown Links` setting.  The expected behavior for this setting is described [here](https://code.visualstudio.com/updates/v1_28#_markdown-preview-now-opens-links-to-local-files-in-the-preview).  In my case, both options (`inPreview` and `inEditor`) yield the same behavior, described below.  

A MWE is attached: [LinkTest.zip](https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/files/3642759/LinkTest.zip)

### Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open markdown file.
2. Open preview to the side.
3. Click link in preview of markdown file.
4. Result:
    - New editor tab with the linked file opens in the same group/panel as the preview tab.

### Additional tests:

- [x] Tested using the latest insiders build: same result
- [x] Tested without any extensions: same result

title: Individual navigation history per "editor window" instead of global.
body:
Couldn't find any information on this if it already exists or there are any solutions.
Could there be an option to have individual navigation history per (unsure of terminology here) "editor pane". 

If I have a two split and browse back and fourth on both and I am at the place where I want my right editor to be, pressing back on my mouse in my left editor should only navigate back its own history, and not touch the right one.
If there are multiple tabs in an editor, I want it to switch between those, and only those.

title: Application (non-editor) font not changing
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Manjaro KDE 

Steps to Reproduce:

1. I recently changed the font for the whole OS from `font-1` to `font-2`. With this, the font of text in `settings`, `side-bar`, `menu`, `status-bar`, etc. of VSCODE also changed. (I have set the vscode-editor font as something else.) 

2. But when I changed the whole OS font from `font-2` to `font-3`, the font of texts in `settings`, `side-bar`, `menu`, `status-bar`, etc. of VSCODE is still stuck at `font-2`. 

3. I tried several things --- (i) changed the OS font to `font-4`, (ii) reinstalled VSCODE. None of these changed the font of VSCODE. Still the whole application has `font-2`

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: Yes

Note:
1. In settings, I have set `Window: Title Bar Style` as `custom`.
2. I looked up stackoverflow. There were few related questions --- [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/29960057/which-font-is-used-in-visual-studio-code-editor-and-how-to-change-fonts?) and [this](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/51255530/how-to-set-menu-font-for-vscode-in-linux?) --- but with no answers

title: Extension development: Add debug-hover-like data navigation to regular hovers
body: My extension (Calva, a Clojure extension) connects the editor view with the REPL running ”inside” the application under development. It blurs the borders between debugging and coding. In particular, you do not need to be in debug mode to query the value of some variable. In Calva you can evaluate a form and see the result inline in the editor. I am right now adding a hover so that you can examine the results a bit closer. It looks like so: For large data structures, this gets not so nice, though. It would be much better to present it like data is presented in debug hovers, where the user can navigate the data vi unfolding the pieces of interest.

title: [Feature] Visual Studio Online - running in a browser add build for Plattform server
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
there is a project called cdr/code-server that already implaments that i think we should implament that directly

<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->
## Progress Tracking:
- Build web - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/74393
- Add vscode-web-server - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81474


## Fix issues with web
- Url Bugs when vscode-web gets served by the server.
- mouse events fix firefox - https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/81472

## Related issues:
- https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/8721
- https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/24320
- https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/issues/63408



we can archive that via the following steps

there are some files that get patched to load existing resources:

- https://github.com/cdr/code-server/blob/master/scripts/vscode.patch 

There are some extra files that get imported for the build 
- https://github.com/cdr/code-server/tree/master/src

The server build gets packaged with node binary it self at present the code-server project is using a own packager called nbin it works and there are other solutions but the nbin one is working well and LGTM


# Issue List
- Create a better way to archive that without patching
  - add https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/tree/master/src/vs/platform /server
- Add missing code from that repo to the main repo 
- add documentation.
- Create Release build chain

# Issues (Patch)
- The Url needs to get Corrected and other Path variables
- Language Pack Loading
- modifyed build from /build/gulpfile.vscode.js => /build/gulpfile.vscode.server.js /build/gulpfile.vscode.electron.js?
- /src/vs/base/common/network.ts
```patch
@@ -82,13 +82,11 @@ class RemoteAuthoritiesImpl {
 	}
 
 	public rewrite(authority: string, path: string): URI {
-		const host = this._hosts[authority];
-		const port = this._ports[authority];
 		const connectionToken = this._connectionTokens[authority];
 		return URI.from({
 			scheme: platform.isWeb ? this._preferredWebSchema : Schemas.vscodeRemoteResource,
-			authority: `${host}:${port}`,
-			path: `/vscode-remote-resource`,
+			authority: window.location.host,
+			path: `${window.location.pathname.replace(/\/+$/, '')}/vscode-remote-resource`,
 			query: `path=${encodeURIComponent(path)}&tkn=${encodeURIComponent(connectionToken)}`
 		});
 	}
```
- Remove Custom Marketplace https://github.com/cdr/code-server/blob/master/src/marketplace.ts

title: don't use ParsedArgs in rawDebugSession; fixes #80461
Emmet not working in Portable Mode
body:
This is my first ever bug report.
I noticed that Emmet doesn't work with VSCode v1.38.1.0 in Portable Mode.

If you start VSCode, Emmet will either work once and then stop working, or it will not work at all.

Changing settings that might be related to auto-suggest and Emmet doesn't make any difference. Pressing [Ctrl+Space] shows "Loading..." in the suggestion menu and it doesn't load any suggestions.

The issue happens even with all extensions disabled.

Portable Mode is setup as described on VSCode [site](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/portable).
Auto Suggest is ON (also doesn't work with OFF).

Haven't tried the Insider version.

Windows 10 (1809)

title: Git: "git not found" error, macOS, when xcodebuild license needs renewing

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body: It appears that on macOS if xcodebuild license needs renewing VSCode throws a "git not found" error. ``` Lukes-iMac-2:skatex lukepighetti$ git Agreeing to the Xcode/iOS license requires admin privileges, please run “sudo xcodebuild -license” and then retry this command. ``` Aaaaand now it works

It would be nice if extension webviews could have  a human readable tooltip in the explorer. Not something like "\webview-panel\webview...". I found nothing in the extension API to set the explorer tooltip. The webview-sample (https://github.com/microsoft/vscode-extension-samples/tree/master/webview-sample) shows this generic tooltip as well.

title: Wrap content in variables and watch views

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Describe the feature you'd like. -->

During debugging, my variable names are long and its content is long too. So Variables/Watch/CallStack/Breakpoints windows cannot show all contents.

Please support customized font setting for debugger windows. If possible, I want to use smaller font in these windows.

Another request: if the variable is a list and its content is long, current window just show "...". So can the windows "wrap" the text and show all the contents?

title: Windows Ctrl+Alt+E get translated in keyboard shortcut as E
body:
**Description**
If you try to define a keyboard shortcut on Windows 10 using German(Germany) keyboard layout containing `Ctrl+Alt+E` vscode translates this sequence as the single letter `E`.  Any keyboard layout which translates `Ctrl+Alt+E` to the `€` sign like  for example French(France), Swedish(Sweden) or Spanish(Spain) are affected as well. If you use a extension which defines shortcuts containing `Ctrl+Alt+E` as default these shortcuts will not work.

- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 (any keyboard layout which translates `Ctrl+Alt+E` to the `€` sign) 

**Steps to Reproduce:**
1. Open `Keyboard Shortcuts` (`Ctrl-K Ctrl+S`)
2. Try to change the shortcut for a command. 
3. If you type `Ctrl-Alt+E` into the edit field only the letter `E` will appear.

**Note**
I was able to define keyboard shortcuts containing `Ctrl+Alt+E` using other software on my system correctly like the IntelliJ and PHPStorm IDE.

title: Changes v1.38 in to autoClosingBrackets vs Completion order is breaking intellisense
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38
- OS Version: Windows 10 1903 Build 18362.356

In the [AL Language](https://marketplace.visualstudio.com/items?itemName=ms-dynamics-smb.al) extension we offer both keyword intellisense and autoClosingBrackets for our block keywords. The AL Language is Pascal based e.g. blocks are surrounded with begin/end.

Our language configuration.json contains 

```
    "autoClosingPairs": [
        { "open": "begin", "close": "end;", "notIn": ["string", "comment"] }
    ],

```

At the same time we offer generic contextual keyword intellisense based on our syntax definition through a CompletionRequest.

Up until v1.38 this worked perfectly. The user started typing "begin" was presented with the begin keyword completion when selected the autoClosingPairs kicked in a inserted the closing pairs. 
Begining from v1.38 something has changed. When begin is typed fully out then closing "end;" is shown but when typing <enter> to split the begin/end; then the closing "end;" is deleted. 

Steps to Reproduce:

1.  Download and install the AL Language extension
2. Use the AL:Go! command from the command palette to get a skeleton project
3. After the Message() in the trigger start type begin followed by <enter>

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: No

title: Go to file: prefix with / to prefer results in root
body:
I'd like to open `index.html` in root. Using the "go to file" feature for that is currently not friendly because it's a 14th match. In general, the sorting feels totally random.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/611746/65364240-20b92680-dbd6-11e9-8160-c4a941257677.png)

Feature request: prepend the search with `/`, e.g. `/index.html` to indicate which index.html I want.

title: Hotkey to close all Deleted file windows
body:
I love that vscode has the default for Close File on Delete to `false` but it would be great if there was an easy way to close all files currently open that are considered _Deleted_. Sometimes switching between branches i'll have dozens of files go into deleted status, and because of the challenge, I end up closing all files, only to re-open those that matter.

It would be much easier if I could bind a hotkey combo to close all files with the `deleted` status so I don't have to re-open those that I need are are still on the FS.

title: Terminal Sidebar
body:
Issue Type: Bug When I have the terminal/search feature as the sidebar, the width changes on me when I lock my computer and come back to the program later. I like the sidebar wider than the default, but it seems to go back to the default every time. Is there a way to set the default width or is this a bug? title: Clicking Markdown link in preview should not open new tab if file is already open
body:
## Current behavior

The current behavior is very confusing to me.  Take the following example:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29213686/65337537-f6dc1180-db8d-11e9-8c2b-420f16cb2f26.png)

Two editor tabs are open in the left group, one containing TestA.md and the other TestB.md.  In the right group is the preview tab.  Each Markdown file has a link to the other file.  Clicking the link in the preview tab opens a new editor tab (containing the linked file) in the same group as the preview tab (despite the file already being open):

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29213686/65337837-939eaf00-db8e-11e9-832f-c18c6a1ff586.png)

## Desired behavior

Clicking a link in the preview should focus (i.e., bring forward) the existing editor tab containing the linked file (if it is already open).  So clicking the link to TestB.md in TestA.md should result in the follow state:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/29213686/65338000-e1b3b280-db8e-11e9-9523-fd6bf2f5bffc.png)

title: Cannot specify global problemMatcher in tasks.json
body:
<!-- Please search existing issues to avoid creating duplicates. -->
<!-- Also please test using the latest insiders build to make sure your issue has not already been fixed: https://code.visualstudio.com/insiders/ -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issue to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.38.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.14.4

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Specify `"problemMatcher": []` at top level of `tasks.json` object
2. Run a task (i.e. an npm task) that has no task config
3. VS Code still prompts you for how to scan the task output

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Does this issue occur when all extensions are disabled?: No

### Other comments
Essentially, I want to be able to disable the problem matcher by default. Personally, I never use it, and it's just noise, because every time I run a task I haven't ran before, I have to select `Never scan the task output`, which opens up `tasks.json` and adds a new config for that task, just so it can specifiy `"problemMatcher": []`.

### Related issues
- https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/43003
  - This issue was closed, but I still have the problem

title: Feature Request: Sidebar AutoReveal Filtering

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

body:
Several people have brought up instances where `explorer.autoReveal`, when activated, causes an undesirable change to the sidebar. It would be nice if there were a richer way to configure this option.

For me, the main complaint with autoReveal is when i ctrl-click on a type in a TypeScript project, which jumps me deep into node_modules where the `.d.ts` file is. i'll usually look through that file, close it, and go back to what i was coding. However, because of autoReveal, i now have node_modules expanded, which on large projects completely overwhelms my sidebar. I'd like to have a way to either explicitly add paths to ignore, or have a way to use say, .gitignore's paths (i know they're evaluated in some fashion since they're de-emphasized visually in the sidebar).

I'm aware that there's a way to hover/display a pop-up of a definition, but more often than not, i'll just use the default 'go to' since its the easiest, and in many cases i do need to see more context from that overall typing definition file.

title: Terminal window doesn't open at startup
body:
Issue Type: Bug I changed my Terminal->Integrated: Cwd setting to "$(workspaceFolder)". Now, when Code starts up, the Terminal does not open, and I get a notification: "The terminal shell CWD "/home/gpudb/gpudb-dev-7.0/gpudb-core/gaiadb-cluster/${workspaceFolder}" does not exist". This happens every time I launch Code. However, once Code has loaded, I can then do Ctrl-` to open a Terminal window, and it works as expected (also every time). Note that this is doing Remote development (so the Terminal is opening a session on my remote machine). I suspect the issue is that Code is trying to start the Terminal before $workspaceFolder is set, but it is set later, when I manually open the Terminal. It is a fairly easy work-around, but am reporting it in case this is not the expected behavior.
